ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained so much insight into movement and its relation to other disciplines.

This class has not only refined how I examine artistic work, but it had provided me with the fundamentals necessary to dance effectively. I have left this class with an improved posture and lifted appearance. And I have also learnt the importance of moving intentionally when dancing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the fact that this class had a movement practice nearly every single class. This is a different type of learning that I am used to. However, the movement practices did get repetitive some days. I also appreciated that the instructor took time to engage with each student individually, asking them probing questions and asking them to demonstrate what was being learnt. I, however, felt that these times of discussions grew too wearisome at times.
I think the course could focus just on movement practice and guest speakers and not have any discussions. I Learned the most from just trying to move and follow professor Robinsons direction.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this to any student interested in learning more about dance.

I definitely would recommend this class to students who seek to explore a different learning style. It will definitely challenge their previous conceptions about dancing and will provide them with an opportunity to explore their body through dance.
Yes, I learned a lot about myself and my body and how I move through the world.
